required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Telerehabilitation & Telecoaching of Parents of Cochlear Implanted Children at Sohag University Hospital
clinical_study.official_title: Telerehabilitation and Telecoaching of Parents of Cochlear Implanted Children at Sohag University Hospital

brief_summary.textblock: Design online program for language sessions for cochlear implanted children in arabic and monitor its validity and reliability to improve language outcome

detailed_description.textblock: Design online program for teletherapy and coach parents to improve language of their children with cochlear implant and evaluate language outcome before and after teletherapy and compare it with control group who will take classical face to face sessions

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Two groups of cochlear implanted children one group will take sessions online (case group) and the other group will take sessions face to face (control group)

primary_outcome.measure: changes at Sohag university hospital protocol for hearing impaired children
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from Before sessions and after 3months and 6months of sessions
primary_outcome.description: Measurement of changes at receptive (0 - 94) and expressive (0-94) language scores and auditory score (0 - 28) higher scores means better outcomes (El-Adawy et al., 2020)

primary_outcome.measure: changes at Preschool language scale four
primary_outcome.time_frame: changes from Before sessions and after 3 months and 6 months of sessions
primary_outcome.description: changes at Receptive raw score (0-62) and expressive language raw score (0-71) and total raw score (0-133) and receptive standard score (43-106), expressive standard score (42-115) and total standard score (55- 115) higher scores means better outcomes (El Sady et al., 2011)

secondary_outcome.measure: changes at the Arabic version of Stanford Binet intelligence scale fifth edition (Faraj, 2010)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: changes from Before sessions and after 6 months of sessions
secondary_outcome.description: Intelligence quotient measure score (50- 160) higher scores means better outcomes

arm_group.description: Group of cochlear implanted children who will take sessions online by the Arabic online program that will be designed
Group of cochlear implanted children who will take sessions face to face in the classical way (control group)

intervention.description: Language Sessions online and coaching parents online to improve language and social outcomes of their children
Language sessions Face to Face at sohag phoniatrics unit

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Cochlear implanted children with non verbal intelligence quotient 80 or above
- parents are compliant to the sessions
Exclusion Criteria:
- cochlear implanted children who have non verbal intelligence quotient less than 80 using the Arabic version of Stanford Binet intelligence scale 5th edition
- parents are non compliant to sessions

reference.citation: El-Adawy, A., Emam, A., Mostafa, E., Gelaney, A. & Awad, H. (2020): Assessment protocol for Auditory and Language Abilities in Cochlear Implanted Children used in Sohag university hospital. Egyptian Journal of Neck Surgery and Otorhinolaryngology, 6(1), 17-36.
El-Sady, S.R., El-Shoubary, A.M., Hafez, G.N. & Abo-Hasseba, A.M. (2011): Translated, modified and standardized Preschool Language Scale [Unpublished Thesis]. 4th ed. Cairo: Ain Shams Medical School.
Faraj, S., (2010): Stanford-Binet Intelligence Scales (SB5), Fifth Edition. Cairo: the Anglo Egyptian Bookshop.
